required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: NAD+ Augmentation in Cardiac Surgery Associated Myocardial Injury Trial
clinical_study.official_title: NAD+ Augmentation in Cardiac Surgery Associated Myocardial Injury (NACAM) Trial

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: A Randomized, Double-blind, placebo-controlled Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy of Oral Nam for the Prevention of Acute Kidney Injury in Patients Undergoing On-Pump Cardiac Surgery

detailed_description.textblock:
This trial is a single-center, randomized, double-blind placebo-controlled Trial of Nam versus placebo in patients undergoing on-pump cardiac surgery. After screening and enrollment, patients will be stratified according to CKD status (eGFR<45 ml/min/m2) and surgical site and randomized in a 1:1 manner to receive either Nam 3 grams or placebo on the day of surgery and post-surgical days one and two.
The overall trial duration is planned for 42 months, consisting of 39 months of active recruitment and treatment period and three months of follow-up from the last patient enrolled.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to three days after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Troponin T AUC, composed of single daily serum measurements

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean difference in uQuin/Tryp ratio AUC
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to three days after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Mean difference in uQuin/Tryp ratio AUC composed of single daily serum measurements

other_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with the following Adverse Events and Serious Adverse Events
other_outcome.description: Postoperative dysrhythmias Postoperative re-hospitalization. Heart failure Surgical wound infection Transfusion requiring perioperative bleed Post-surgical deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary emboli Nosocomial infection Nausea and vomiting Adverse events leading to treatment discontinuation Perioperative liver injury (x2 upper normal-limit) Post-operative thrombosis and pulmonary emboli Impairment of renal function (KDIGO AKI)
• Mean length of index hospital stay (days)

other_outcome.measure: Length of intensive care unit stay.
other_outcome.description: • Mean length of intensive care unit stay (days)
• Mean daily perioperative fluid volume administration

other_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to three days after surgery
other_outcome.description: BNP AUC, composed of single daily serum measurements

intervention.description: Niacinamide 3 grams on the day of surgery and post-surgical days one and two
Matched placebo on the day of surgery and post-surgical days one and two

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria
- Informed consent before any study-related activities.
- Men or women >18 years of age who are scheduled for non-emergent cardiac surgery procedures requiring CPB and are at increased risk for surgery-related adverse cardiovascular outcomes.
Procedures include:
- CABG
- Aortic, mitral, tricuspid, or pulmonic valve replacement or repair
- CABG with aortic, mitral, tricuspid, and/or pulmonic valve replacement
Risk factors for surgery related to adverse cardiovascular outcomes include one or more of the following:
- Valve surgery
- eGFR < 45 ml/min/1.73m2
- Documented LVEF ≤ 35% within six months before surgery
- Documented history of heart failure
- Insulin-requiring diabetes
- Non-insulin-requiring diabetes and the presence of ≥+2 proteinuria on urinalysis (or equivalent on urine protein-to-creatinine ratio or urine albumin-to-creatinine ratio)
- Preoperative anemia (hemoglobin <11g/dl for men and women)
- History of prior CABG
- Age ≥65
Exclusion Criteria
- Preexisting AKI within seven days before surgery as defined by KDIGO stage ≥1 (serum creatinine-based)
- Kidney transplant status
- Off-pump cardiac surgery
- ESRD
- Emergent cardiac surgery
- Pregnancy
- Patient enrolled in competing research studies that may affect outcomes
- Patients held in an institution by legal or official order

facility.name: Kaiser Permanente San Francisco Medical Center
